intro: Oxycladium, commonly known as the marsh gentian, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Gentianaceae. These plants are typically found in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. They are characterized by their showy, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Oxycladium species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and floral display. The plants are also known for their ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-poor soils.
